hero.name: jan Sijan
hero.intro: toki! mi jan Sijan. nimi mi li AnalogCyan lon ilo sona. mi pali e ilo pona. mi pona e ilo ike. mi lukin e ijo nasa. o sona mute

meta.description: lipu mi pi ijo pali en ijo sona.

about.title: About Me
about.intro: Hi, I’m Cyan—online I go by AnalogCyan. I use she/her pronouns, and I’m proudly neurodivergent. That means my brain takes its own path sometimes, so I really appreciate your patience!
about.body1: By day, you can find me fixing up broken tech. By night, I’m usually programming, tinkering with gadgets, or chasing whatever random idea has grabbed my attention. Outside of work, I’m into linguistics, retro games, speedrunning, and collecting cassette tapes. They’re clunky yet charming!
about.body2: Oh, and one last thing: take care of your digital security! If you’re not already using a password manager, 2fa, or passkeys, now’s a great time to start. I personally recommend 1Password, but honestly, anything’s better than using your pet’s name for every login.

projects.intro: Explore some of the projects I've created or contributed to. Click on any to learn more! For additional projects, visit my GitHub. Unless otherwise noted, content on this website is licensed under GPLv3.

sticky.title: Sticky Paws
sticky.desc: A 2D platformer game about a cat that can climb anything! Main game by Jonnil; server code by me.

swiftwin.title: SwiftWin
swiftwin.desc: PowerShell utility for performing a series of Windows maintenance tasks I commonly use when cleaning up and optimizing a system.

itadakimasu.title: Itadakimasu
itadakimasu.desc: Random recipe password generator web app inspired by episode "Nice Security Hollywood Terror" of the Random but Memorable podcast from 1Password.

thayncc.title: thayn.cc
thayncc.desc: A simple from-scratch private link shortener API.

dor.title: DNS-over-RNG
dor.desc: A very cursed DNS server implementation inspired by the various DNS-over-protocol standards.

mobs.title: More Vanilla Mobs
mobs.desc: Minecraft 1.17+ data pack that implements some of the mobs that technically exist in the game, but don't appear in survival.

inventory.title: InventorySystem
inventory.desc: Medical sample inventory management system, created as our senior project in the COMS 4043 course at Arkansas Tech University.

photos.title: Photos
photos.body: A space for photo sets, experiments, and visual notes. I’ll be adding galleries and highlights here soon.
photos.prompt: Want a peek in the meantime?

music.title: Music
music.body: You can find me on a variety of music related platforms. Not every profile is up-to-date, but they are all collected here for the sake of completeness.
music.body2: For a live look at what is actually in rotation, the Last.fm widget at the top of the page mirrors my current listening activity from my library and links directly to my profile there.
music.prompt: In the meantime, here are my music profiles:
music.clientsBody: I host my personal music library on Valkyrie, my homelab server, using Navidrome.
music.clientsBody2: Every album I care about lives there in full quality, properly tagged, with artwork and metadata exactly how I want it. Nothing disappears because of licensing changes. Nothing gets edited or swapped out without me knowing.
music.clientsBody3: I prefer owning my music instead of renting access to it. Streaming is convenient, but convenience is not the same thing as control. When you self host, your library is yours. It works offline. It does not get pulled. It does not change unless you decide to change it.
music.clientsBody4: If that approach appeals to you, it is more approachable than it sounds. All you really need are your files, a small server or spare machine, and the right client apps to access your collection from anywhere.
music.clientsLead: These are the clients I recommend:

lastfmCapsule.title: Last.fm
lastfmCapsule.idleBody: Not currently scrobbling. Here is the latest activity.
lastfmCapsule.errorBody: Could not load Last.fm right now. Try again in a bit.
lastfmCapsule.noData: No recent listening data available right now.

footer.quote: sina ken awen lon nasa ala nasa?
